title: Ticket #7512: Prevent FileTransfer from publishing sensitive URL data
description:
Currently our FileTransfer object publishes URLs it wants to access to the transfer_history log, job hold messages and in some cases to other log files. In many cases this is very useful for debugging while file transfers are not working. Unfortunately it's also a security concern, since many places where URLs get published are world readable. This is especially true for S3 file transfers, where we publish access token information into the URL.

We want to sanitize URLs in the FileTransfer object before publishing them anywhere. One suggestion was to strip all the GET arguments (following the ? character) although I don't think this is a good idea, since very often that information is useful for debugging, also because it's possible for sensitive data to appear before it. I propose that we come up with a whitelist of expressions which we redact or remove completely from the URLs.
